kevingoldman.name: Kevin Goldman
kevingoldman.about: Kevin Goldman is an industrial designer turned software designer. His software adventure began in the mid ‘90s in Seattle crafting claymation CD-ROMs. He was an indie web and app designer for a long time. Now he’s the founder of 29th Drive, Inkwell, and MoreBlu. These days, he lives in Scottsdale with his wife and two boys.

cwiiis.name: Chris Lord
cwiiis.about: Mozillian and GNOME Foundation member, hacks on Firefox for Android, formerly of Intel and OpenedHand

mainroach.name: Colt McAnlis
mainroach.about: Developer Advocate at Google working on Chrome Games , Web Performance and Native Client

wd45.name: Clinton Forry
wd45.about: Clinton Forry is a senior content strategist at Ameriprise Financial. He writes about content on his Content-ment blog. He’s on Twitter as @wd45. When he’s not thinking about content, he’s probably thinking about vinyl LP jazz records. And he fancies wearing ties with his paisley and floral print shirts.

stevenbradley.name: Steven Bradley
stevenbradley.about: Web designer, WordPress developer, blogger and forum owner.

russmaxdesign.name: Russ Weakley
russmaxdesign.about: Russ has worked in the graphic design arena for over 20 years, with a major portion of that time spent specialising in web development and design.

markodugonjic.name: Marko Dugonjić
markodugonjic.about: Marko Dugonjić is a designer, speaker and web enthusiast running a nano-scale web design studio Creative Nights in Velika Gorica, Croatia. The domain name is after his nick Maratz.

hirokitakeuchi.name: Hiroki Takeuchi
hirokitakeuchi.about: Before founding GoCardless, Hiroki worked closely with Global Financial Institutions at McKinsey & Company. Hiroki studied Mathematics at Oxford University, and has interned at J.P. Morgan and Auctomatic.

dudleystorey.name: Dudley Storey
dudleystorey.about: Web development instructor, designer & writer; author of Pro CSS3 Animation (Apress, 2013)

briansuda.name: Brian Suda
briansuda.about: Brian Suda is an informatician residing in Reykjavík, Iceland. He’s written a book on the topic of charts and graphs entitled Designing with Data. His own little patch of internet is at suda.co.uk where many past projects and crazy ideas can be found.

elliotjaystocks.name: Elliot Jay Stocks
elliotjaystocks.about: Designer, speaker, and author. He is one half of Viewport Industries and the founder of typography magazine 8 Faces.

bih.name: Bilawal Hameed
bih.about: At best, I am a passionate builder. I build software, companies, communities, and people. I aim to build world-class products that ooze excellence and perfection by imperfection. I work hard to listen and to innovate. During my career to date, I have built three startups (two acquired, one funded), built circa. 50 projects, received numerous mentions, attended 3 events & 8 hackathons (and won 2) along with a Dev8D Top Developer award.

thebabydino.name: Ana Tudor
thebabydino.about: Loves maths, especially geometry. Enjoys playing with code. Passionate about experimenting & learning new things. Fascinated by astrophysics and science in general. Huge fan of technological advance & its applications in all fields. Shows an interest in motor sports, drawing, classic cartoons, rock music, cuddling toys and animals with sharp claws & big teeth. Dreams about owning a real tiger one day.

gabrieleromanato.name: Gabriele Romanato
gabrieleromanato.about: Gabriele Romanato is a web developer. Contributor of the W3C CSS Test Suite, he is also skilled with jQuery and WordPress.

mullican.name: Lyle Mullican
mullican.about: Lyle Mullican is a web solutions architect at Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota, where he builds web applications for laboratory professionals. You can find him on the usual social networks. Previously, Lyle managed the operations of a web development consultancy. He has two small children and occasionally produces fine art. All views expressed are, of course, the author’s own.

timwright12.name: Tim Wright
timwright12.about: Tim Wright is the senior user experience designer and developer at Fresh Tilled Soil, a UX design agency out of Boston. He is a frequent speaker, blogger, and writer, and a published author. He also recently wrote a book, Learning JavaScript—A Hands-On Guide to the Fundamentals of Modern JavaScript.

csswizardry.name: Harry Roberts
csswizardry.about: Hi there, I’m Harry. I am a 22 year old designer, developer, writer and speaker from the UK; I work as a Senior UI Developer for BSkyB. I write, tweet, speak and share code about authoring and scaling CSS for big websites.

matmuchrapna.name: Владимир Старков
matmuchrapna.about: Меня зовут Владимир Старков. Я стараюсь cделать мир лучше. Мне можно написать в твиттер или прямо на почту

rodweb.name: Игорь Дерябин
rodweb.about: Развиваюсь и совершенствуюсь в области веб-разработки.

silentimp.name: Антон Немцев
silentimp.about: Люблю людей? Большинство из вас мне даже не нравится. И, да, я эксцентричный, сломленный, уставший мизантроп. Идите к черту.

newtron.name: Dave Newton
newtron.about: Dave is a full-stack developer in Toronto. His day job is in a Knowledge Translation research program, where he gets to pursue his interests in making the web more usable, useful, and accessible. Dave has a beard, but it's not because he thinks it looks good; he's just too lazy to shave.

tetz2442.name: Jon Tetzlaff
tetz2442.about:
My name is Jon and I develop websites.
I have a Bachelors Degree in Web and Digital Media Development from the University of Wisconsin - Stevens Point. Developing for the web has been my passion and hobby since I started in 2009.

I currently live in Wausau, Wisconsin where I work at Footlocker.com/Eastbay as a Front-End Developer. In my spare time I continue to improve my skills by working on my blog and other projects.

I invite you take a look around my portfolio. Don't forget to connect to me elsewhere on the web!

karenmcgrane.name: Karen McGrane
karenmcgrane.about: Karen McGrane plays nicely in the content strategy, information architecture, and interaction design sandboxes. She is the author of Content Strategy for Mobile from A Book Apart; Managing Partner at Bond Art + Science, a UX consultancy she founded in 2006; and formerly VP and National Lead for User Experience at Razorfish. She’s led projects for dozens of clients, including The New York Times, Condé Nast, and The Atlantic. She also teaches Design Management in the Interaction Design MFA program at the School of Visual Arts.

thomasjoos.name: Thomas Joos
thomasjoos.about: Thomas Joos is partner and interactive director at Little Miss Robot. He designs creative & innovative digital experiences and directs projects from concept to creation. He is passionate about interactive experiences and UI/UX design. Thomas is also very active in the design community as an inspirational speaker, sharing thoughts and insights on innovative digital creation.

smash_scribe.name: Jan Constantin
smash_scribe.about: Jan Constantin is working at Smashing Media in the marketing department and loves to spend his spare time writing for Smashing Magazine. He is one of the main contributors to the Smashing Media corporate website's blog.

rmurphey.name: Rebecca Murphey
rmurphey.about: Rebecca Murphey is a senior software engineer at Bazaarvoice and a frequent speaker on the topics of code organization and best practices at conferences around the world. She’s also the creator of the TXJS conference, the author of the learning site jQuery Fundamentals, a contributor to the jQuery Cookbook from O’Reilly Media, and a technical reviewer for Effective JavaScript by Dave Herman. She blogs at rmurphey.com, tweets as @rmurphey, and lives in Durham, NC, with her partner.

stephenhay.name: Stephen Hay
stephenhay.about: Stephen Hay is a front-end design and development consultant based in the Netherlands. He is the author of Responsive Design Workflow (Peachpit/New Riders 2013), a contributor to Smashing Book #3, and a frequent speaker. When he’s not working himself to death at his consultancy, Zero Interface, he appreciates a good Belgian ale and blogs about twice a year at the-haystack.com.

rich_clark.name: Richard Clark
rich_clark.about: Richard Clark is Head of Interactive at KMP Digitata, a digital agency based in Manchester, UK. With over 10 years industry experience he oversees the user experience, design and front-end work at KMP and is a regular contributor to industry leading publication, .net magazine. He’s the founder and curator of HTML5 Gallery, co-founder, editor and author for HTML5 Doctor. You’ll also occasionally find him organising Speak the Web, a series of gig-like web conferences.

writebeard.name: Bill Beard
writebeard.about: Bill Beard is a freelance copywriter, creative director and content strategist who connects companies with customers at every touchpoint. He's worked with startups like TheLadders and agencies like Digitas and mcgarrybowen. He's a believer in Lean UX and recently spoke at LeanUXNYC. Bill loves building brands and creating great experiences, but hates talking about himself in the third person.

donovanh.name: Donovan Hutchinson
donovanh.about:
A Dublin based front-end web developer, building interesting things on the web for close to 15 years.

Nowadays I'm mostly working with front-end CSS, HTML and Javascript, both in a load of fun side projects, and within my role as Director of UX for mobile CRM company, Converser. I also run a shopping site people sometimes think of as the Irish version of Amazon.

I occasionally talk on such topics as AngularJS, CSS3 Animation and Node.js.

If you'd like to get in touch, please use d@hop.ie, @donovanh on Twitter, or LinkedIn.

stevefaulkner.name: Steve Faulkner
stevefaulkner.about:
Steven is the Senior Web Accessibility Consultant and Technical Director, TPG Europe. He joined The Paciello Group in 2006 and was previously a Senior Web Accessibility Consultant at vision australia. He is the creator and lead developer of the Web Accessibility Toolbar accessibility testing tool. Steve is a member of several groups, including the W3C HTML Working Group and the W3C Protocols and Formats Working Group. He also develops and maintains www.HTML5accessibility.com

Steve has a Bachelors degree in Psychology form the University of Sydney and a post graduate qualification in Information Technology from Swinburne University

iandevlin.name: Ian Devlin
iandevlin.about: Ian is a web developer at pixolith, a web agency based in Düsseldorf, Germany. He has been interested in HTML5 since late 2009 and also curates at html5gallery, and occasionally writes for other sites and magazines. Outside of the web, he is interested in European history, archaeology and nature. You can find out more at iandevlin.com and by following @iandevlin on Twitter.

tj vantol.name: TJ VanTol
tj vantol.about: I’m a Web Developer working for Liquid Web in Lansing, MI and I have been making web sites since the web was a thing.

witchfinderx.name: Илья Пухальский
witchfinderx.about: Solution Architect в компании EPAM Systems. Веб-разработчик с более чем семилетним опытом, JavaScript-lover. Текущая страсть — разработка мобильных приложений и сайтов.

aurelioderosa.name: Aurelio De Rosa
aurelioderosa.about: I’m an Italian web and app developer who have a bachelor degree in Computer Science and more than 5 years’ experience programming for the web using HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript and PHP. I mainly use the LAMP stack and frameworks like jQuery, jQuery Mobile, Cordova (PhoneGap) and Zend Framework but my interests also include web security, web accessibility, SEO, WordPress and everything I can put my hands on. In the little spare time left, I contribute to the open source community writing libraries for PHP as well as jQuery plugins. After an experience at the University of Salerno, currently I’m self-employed working with the cited technologies. I’m also a regular contributor to the SitePoint network, on four different websites, where I write articles about the topics I usually work with and more.

sherrialexander.name: Sherri Alexander
sherrialexander.about: Sherri Alexander is a front-end developer in the Boston area who delights in bringing web designs to life. She's been making browsers dance to her tune since the olden days of the web, when background images were a neat new idea. When she's not coding, Sherri indulges her inner geek by watching Mythbusters, playing video games, and hosting tabletop gaming nights.

apolaine.name: Andy Polaine
apolaine.about: Andy Polaine is an interaction and service design consultant, writer, and educator. He is co-author of the book Service Design: From Insight to Implementation, published by Rosenfeld Media.

w3c.name: W3C
w3c.about: The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) is an international community where member organizations, a full-time staff, and the public work together to develop web standards.  Led by web inventor Tim Berners-Lee and CEO Jeffrey Jaffe, W3C’s mission is to lead the web to its full potential.

derekjohnson.name: Derek Johnson
derekjohnson.about: Derek works as a senior web developer at Pierce Communications in Belfast. He writes on his own blog at nostrongbeliefs.com and tweets @derekjohnson.

rauschma.name: Axel Rauschmayer
rauschma.about:
Dr. Axel Rauschmayer is a consultant and trainer for JavaScript, web technologies and information management. He has been programming since 1985, developing web applications since 1995 and held his first talk on Ajax in 2006. In 1999, he was technical manager at an internet startup that later expanded internationally.
Located in Munich, Germany. Speaks German, English, French, and Spanish.

oli.name: Oli Studholme
oli.about: He works as a developer for Information Architects, Inc. in Tokyo, Japan. He wrote “Beginning HTML5 and CSS3—The Web Evolved” (Apress) with Rich Clark, Divya Manian, and Christopher Murphy. He also writes at oli.jp and tweets as @boblet. 宜しくね！＾＾

shuvalov-anton.name: Антон Шувалов
shuvalov-anton.about: Немного разбираюсь в этих ваших NodeJS и дизайнах.

mixu.name: Mikito Takada
mixu.about: Node.js developer @trifacta; I write books (http://book.mixu.net/ ) and code (https://github.com/mixu )

ericterpstra.name: Eric Terpstra
ericterpstra.about: Eric is a web developer living in Memphis, TN and works with SandStorm Innovations on a variety of projects using a variety of technologies.  He is also recently the co-founder of Theme Spectre – a source for themes, plugins, and other resources for the Ghost blogging platform. Eric tries desperately to keep up with evolving web standards and modern JavaScript techniques.  When he’s not in front of a computer, Eric can be found playing with gadgets in the kitchen (current favorite: food dehydrator), or bouncing around various meetup groups in Memphis.

travm.name: Travis Maynard
travm.about: Travis Maynard is a front-end web developer that focuses on minimalism and simplicity. He's currently creating efficient web frameworks and user experiences at West Virginia University.

jhooks.name: Joel Hooks
jhooks.about: Hi. My name is Joel Hooks. I’m a software developer by trade, currently residing in Fort Worth, TX. Outside of lovingly shepherding high quality software to release, I spend my time with my lovely wife Kristina and our 4 children.
